title: Explained: Why Muslim vendors are being banned from Karnataka temple fairs - The Indian Express
content:
1. Explained: Why Muslim vendors are being banned from Karnataka temple fairs  The Indian Express
  2. Five Bajrang Dal members held in Karnataka for attacking Muslim meat sellers  The News Minute
  3. Halal meat: Karnataka CM says precautions taken for peaceful celebration of festival  The Hindu
  4. Karnataka: As minister backs anti-halal protests, slaughter norm order raises fears  The Indian Express
  5. Karnataka BJP leaders say Hindus are well within their rights on non-'halal' meat like Muslims are on 'halal'  The Tribune India
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: The BJP government in Karnataka has justified the restrictions on Muslim traders at temple fairs by stating that non-Hindus are barred from having stores in temple premises as per a rule issued in 2002 under the Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Act, 1997.
